cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles south-southeast of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast parallel to the southeast U.S. coast, forecast to turn northeast tonight and accelerate offshore of North Carolina and toward Atlantic Canada.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the North Carolina coast (Cape Lookout–Cape Hatteras area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket and Martha’s Vineyard MA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Savannah River GA to the NC/VA border including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds; Storm-surge warning Savannah River to Poquoson VA including Neuse & Pamlico Rivers and Hampton Roads
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from northern Florida through the Carolinas, then the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely; breezy conditions with occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft and elevated tides/rip currents possible along the northeast Florida beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible, mainly in outer bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal erosion impacting port operations.
